content:
(The scene continues with the gang continuing to argue and make jokes about Mac's conspiracy theories)

Dennis: "Come on Mac, you're like the Dennis of conspiracy theories, always thinking you know better."

Mac: "I do know better! You're just too closed-minded to see it."

Frank: "I don't know about all this, but I do know one thing - I'm getting a little tired of this conversation."

(The door to the pub bursts open and a group of government agents, dressed in black, enter)

Agent: "Freeze! We have reason to believe that one of you is in possession of classified information."

(The gang looks at each other in confusion and terror)

Charlie: "What are you talking about? We're just a bunch of friends having a drink."

Agent: "We'll be the judge of that. We need to take you all in for questioning."

(The agents begin to cuff the gang)

Dennis: "This is insane! We're innocent!"

Mac: "I knew it! They're trying to cover something up!"

Frank: "I don't know what's going on, but it looks like we're in a real-life conspiracy theory now."

(The scene ends with the gang being led out of the pub in handcuffs, as the camera cuts to black)

The scene's genre has changed to a political thriller/crime genre.
